瞎.definition: blind; groundlessly; foolishly; to no purpose

瞎吹.definition: to boast; to shoot one's mouth off

瞎子摸象.definition: blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture; to mistake the part for the whole; unable to see the wood for the trees

瞎弄.definition: to fool around with; to mess with

瞎忙.definition: to putter around; to work to no avail

瞎扯.definition: to talk irresponsibly; to talk nonsense

瞎扯蛋.definition: to talk irresponsibly; to talk nonsense

瞎指揮.definition: to give nonsensical instructions; to issue orders out of ignorance

瞎掰.definition: (coll.) to talk nonsense; to fool around

瞎搞.definition: to fool around; to mess with; to do sth without a plan

瞎晃.definition: to roam about; to monkey around

瞎混.definition: to muddle along; to live aimlessly

瞎猜.definition: to make a wild guess; blind guess

瞎說.definition: to talk drivel; to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact; not to know what one is talking about

瞎貓碰上死耗子.pinyin: xiā māo pèng shàng sǐ hào zi
瞎貓碰上死耗子.definition: a blind cat finds a dead mouse (idiom); blind luck

瞎鬧.definition: to make a scene; to fool around; to behave foolishly
